function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Conflicting results between current study and previous studies regarding the impact of absolute humidity on influenza virus survival","Impact":"Misinterpretation of research findings, potential misallocation of resources for influenza control measures","Mitigation":"Further investigation and replication studies to confirm the impact of absolute humidity on influenza virus survival, consideration of multiple variables and complex models","Technologies":"Statistical modeling, epidemiological modeling, data analysis tools","People":"Public health officials, researchers, epidemiologists","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Misinterpretation of statistical models and their implications for influenza seasonality","Impact":"Inaccurate understanding of the factors influencing influenza seasonality, ineffective public health interventions","Mitigation":"Use of appropriate statistical models, consideration of multiple variables, validation of results through independent studies","Technologies":"Data analysis tools, statistical software, epidemiological modeling tools","People":"Public health officials, epidemiologists, researchers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Overreliance on p-values to determine the influence of environmental variables on influenza seasonality","Impact":"Potential misrepresentation of the significance of environmental variables, misinformed decision-making in public health policy","Mitigation":"Consideration of effect sizes, replication of studies, use of multiple statistical measures, collaboration with domain experts","Technologies":"Statistical software, data analysis tools, collaboration platforms","People":"Public health officials, epidemiologists, researchers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"}]}
